comments.body: Abracadabra

You can add meteor fall magic, lightning magic, water magic, fire magic, gravity magic, ender shooting magic, teleportation, levitation and more. You can use altar, staff wands, gloves or any Items for the magic. It is exciting
I would imagine copper ingots could also have better use in this area. Could copper on staffs/spells.

Copper and amethyst would be suitable ores to use to craft magic weapons. Also, here are some spell ideas:

- Lighting Spell: Shoots a "spell" projectile. Any mob hit is struck by lightning, no matter the circumstance.

- Fire Spell: Shoots a "spell" projectile. Any area hit creates a 5x5 "circle" of fire, kind of like using flint and steel, but in a more significant area.

- Light Spell: Creates light, like placing a torch. Any undead mob in the area takes some damage.

- Wind Spell: Shoots a "spell" projectile. It's kind of like shooting a firework, but instead of exploding, it pulls mobs into the "implosion" site.

The possible spells could be based on your enchantments. If you have respiration, you could use a spell that lets you breath underwater. If you have soul speed and swift sneak, you could use a spell that lets you have the speed effect. To make it so this function isn't to op, using spells could take away some of your food bar.
Imagine Mage/wizard armor kit.
I agree, including ancient stories or journals which could provide clues to the hidden lore of Minecraft.
And maybe dinosaur bones

i was thinking they could add ancient saplings of trees that are extinct and they could be  regional depending on the type of biome you in(hot, cold , temperate, dry, jungle )and you could get more saplings as well when you chop them down and have your own farm of rare trees. they could also do the same thing with plants like they could have corn, eggplants, rice and they wouldnt have to make them better than any other crop just the variety would be nice and i think they should do this because we only have six overworld trees in minecraft there are hundreds in real life i think we could have a few more than what we have same thing with crops

I think for me personally unless it has something I can't get anywhere else I don't see me using it. I think maybe have a unique ancient tool or material that has been lost to time that you can't repair unless you have mending or craft it. Something unique except shards
Mending books should be obtainable trought archeology instead of via villager trading

While this is an amazing idea the archeology system will be built on and these ideas probably won't come for years. While this may be true we can all provide suggestions for mojang and give them ideas. Some of these ideas of course as other comments state could be ancient plants, journels, books or bones. I have ideas of my own like the excavation structures is biome dependent on chance like it is a higher chance in badlands, savanna, or dessert as to simulate old dried up lakes and sediment. Also this would add a chance for anew mob that could be hidden in excavations like say a bone crawler or some other mob. The bone crawler would wait last second when you uncover something as to break it and will also add an effect called bones sickness which gives you nausea wither and slowness effects at the same time with a new effect that makes your world seem to get smaller and you see yourself sinking to the ground. I know it's a stretch but it would be awsome so some things could get added in a bit of time please consider thanks for being awsome mojang

I am a huge archaeology fan I wanted to be a Egyptologist when I was a kid.
I think they should add tombs, magical jewelry, neckless, arm bands, leg bands, head wear, rings, lots of pottery, big vases, large bowls, cups, maybe different types of large, medium and small statues, some tablets with inscriptions in a ancient Minecraft language.

They could add a Mesa/Jungle phantom/ghost that is attached to a haunted tomb and a mummy in the desert.

The new Crop ideas above are really good.


The above is all I could come up with off the top of my head beside bones and ancient herbs.
If they wanted to get really crazy they could add some ancient technologies.
Just take a mule or donkey and give him a chest filled with shulker chests... This should do th job
I think that’s a excellent idea since it’s very much a Minecraft styled idea

Maybe there could be 2 different kinds of wagons; a small one you can pull yourself, and a larger one for a pack animal to pull. The capacity could be like a single chest for yourself, and a double chest for the horse/donkey/mule/llama.

Agreed that there should be multiple levels of this concept.

1. Wheelbarrow.  Used for hauling raw materials including dirt, tree bark, sand, stone, ores, etc.  Craft using a chest minecart, sticks and an axle (wheels plus a stick) (holds one small chest)

2. Wagon - can put one large chest in it and move it around like a boat. Craft using two wheelbarrows.

3. Cart. - craft two wagons to make a cart.  Can attach to a horse and hold two large chests. 

3. Covered wagon. Craft using carts, wood, a bed, a crafting table, and wool of your color.  This becomes a mobile home of sorts, with two chests, a crafting table and a bed inside.  The land version of the large boats MC is considering.
This could also be helpful with the transportation of mobs and villagers, that way you aren't having to boat or minecart a single one

Also, making a specially built wagon to transport animals, villagers, and mobs or a small handcart with a single chest inventory  that can be pulled by the player and set down with a single button click. Wagons would be an alternative to minecarts with significantly less iron usage as railways would be unnecessary and would be able to go uphill easily. Wagons/handcarts should also travel easily when moving over a path and slowly take damage if there is no path.

In addition to a horse, a wagon could attach to a llama, goat, or cow and the movement speed is dependent on the animal (in increasing speed order: goat, cow/mule, llama/donkey, horse).
And maybe there’s should be abandoned wagons around the map that contains loot cheats and only way to get a a wagon

In addition to a wagon, maybe village roads can be widened by two blocks to accommodate wagons moving through. Maybe even have another kind of trader with a wagon that will come into a village every morning and set up shop at a market. This trader specifically would be exclusive to villages.
This sounds like it could also be a great building block with a nice texture too. More variations of stone-like blocks are always welcome
This is a great idea!
Maybe fires lit on it would never go out on their own similar to netherrack. Just an additional feature to add some use besides decoration
Sarebbe bello anche il minerale
Gravel?
I vote Block of Flint for the 2021 Cave Update
Flint blocks could burn fire eternally like how netherrack does, allowing for fires to be made without having to use the netherrack texture.
I think a flint block should be like black gravel.
Every time you move the piston, it lights up.
Scraping an iron block away from a flint block with a piston creates fire where the iron block was.

I saw someone show off a flint block that when a block of iron moves adjacent to it (from a piston), the flint sparks and lights the space where the iron was. This could be interesting for redstone contraptions
This is a great idea.

While this may seems like a good idea, is nothing else than a way to make resources and features that had been updated recently obsolete...

I'm sorry but this is just for mods.
Love this idea
Mike T.A., That's like saying that the fire aspect should be removed because it makes smokers obsolete.
I also had the same idea. I think, however, it should only work with ores. Being used on stone would be very annoying.
The first time to ever have fortune on iron
add
Having it work like that would be extremely OP. It should only work on ores. Maybe it could be combined with fortune?

I like this idea, but I think it shouldn’t work on wood, as it is supposed to be mined with an axe rather than a pickaxe, and I don’t think it should smelt cobblestone because that would make it harder for resource collecting if you wanted cobblestone.

To expand upon this idea as a whole, I think it should conflict with silk touch (as those two enchantments wouldn’t go together by their nature). I think it would be cool if it had five enchantment levels, with level I having a 25% chance to make ores smelt, level II have a 50% chance, level III having a 75% chance, and level IV having a 100% chance. By level V, which would have to be made by combining two level IV books on an anvil, the Fortune enchantment would have an effect on the ores the pickaxe would smelt. The enchantment would have an enchantment weight of one, meaning it would have the lowest possible chance of appearing as an option on an enchantment table, due to how overpowered it is. Perhaps if enough people feel it is too overpowered at this point, it could just be a treasure enchantment, making it unobtainable via enchantment table. Also, if enough people feel the level V ability is too overpowered, than I would suggest that it also conflict with Fortune, and have only four enchantment levels, all doing the same thing as described earlier.

What do you guys think of this?

This would be a good enchantment for 1.17 cave's and cliff update bedrock edition instead of having to go back in force into your house to smelt the ores! Because there is some new stuff coming to Minecraft and the cave and cliff update is bigger!
I had that idea aswell

I had this same idea. The name of the enchantment could use some thought, however. I think that it would be a nice edition into the game, being able to auto smelt ores to save time but as a drawback this enchantment could be incompatible with Fortune. Also, I think that it should only work on ores, not with cobble or charcoal.

This is a great idea. It should be mutually exclusive to Silk Touch and Fortune. One coal for one coal ore. One iron ingot for one iron. One netherite scrap for one ancient debris. One charcoal for one wood. One smooth stone for one stone. Etc.
If i know Mojang they will just make the Alex head more important, despite your request for them not to. They believe it promotes gender equality, when in reality it's merely making up for the past

I can't believe I never recognized this. The reason why Steve has a head is because he was the first thing to represent a human or "a player" in Minecraft. Alex was added 4 years later so she isn't as og as Steve was. And Steve's head is called a Player Head, not a Steve head so that's probably why they didn't add an Alex head.
Alex's head is a good idea because this is Steve's and how can one use skin Alex and Steve, why not put Alex's head? I was going to publish your idea but I saw that you put it first and I liked it

I am making a world on creative mode, using armor stands to liven things, however I can only use Steve heads which is really disappointing. Please add an Alex head as the amount of heads in the game is really lacking.
Alex head on armor stand = female characters in maps.
There's only a steve head because they added all the heads in a way earlier update and probably just didn't think about it.
(You know, you can change the texture of a player head if you use commands...)

probably because there aren't iron fences (yet)
Ooh with a chain-link fence?? Feedback suggestions here I come!
I've always wondered if this idea had been posted. I first had the idea on my own before Iron trap doors. I have always wanted to see it, but I don't know what practical use would be.
Iron gates would be good to keep mobs out. They also could be used for gates if building an amusement park.

More gate is good idea.
And more redstone block.
try connect redstone to gate
Yes. There should be iron fence gates. Like I have an iron fenced place but I have to but a wooden fence gat instead which doesnt really match.

The crafting recipe for Bucket of Chocolate Milk should be 1 Bucket of Milk, 1 Cocoa Bean, and 1 Sugar.    Drinking chocolate milk will remove all negative status effects while all positive status effects are preserved and provides some positive status effects to the player.
Glow stone? XP

The block is already in the game (bedrock version) but they refuse to add it in the creative inventory for unknown reasons, it's genuinely a great block for decoration and it could be crafted with redstone in survival if they decide to make it obtainable via survival too kinda like one redstone in the middle and 8 obsidians around the redstone, giving 8 glowing obsidians, it genuinely is great for decoration and as a lighting block in general, plus, it's already implemented, it just needs a name and a craft if they want it obtainable in survival, the block ID: 246

 

But i genuinely belive the glowing obsidian should be in the game "oficially" and not like a secret item.

its cool

gloing obsidian

a crafting recepie would be obsidian and glowstone on the sides

this block should only be exclusive to bedrock edition due to the history of glowing obsidian existing in early pocket edition days as a way to get nether blocks
this block should only be exclusive to bedrock edition due to the history of glowing obsidian existing in early pocket edition days as a way to get nether blocks

plus we need another obsidian variant for nether.. it such a waste if glowing obsidian didn't add into minecraft

It shouldn't be just for creative mode, it should be for survival too. It's such a cool block that has a lot of potential.
i agree, there is no reson mojang has to remove glowing-obsidian (i gave you the 50th vote, i feel good now)

Please add this item to Minecraft Bedrock. It's pretty popular and has lots of uses. It also provides some nostalgia for those of us who played MCPE in its early days. Not to mention that adding a new, simple block is probably pretty easy.

At least roses are very obvious, as a two tall plant with red on top, and so would be easy to avoid.
Exactly! And even then, it would only be a major problem during UHCs (as best as I know, anyway).

Just for everyone's benefit: this post used to contain three separate ideas, two of which I deleted for different reasons. The first idea was to port Bedrock Edition snow and snowfall behavior to Java Edition, since it is so beautiful and immersive in Bedrock Edition; however, I deleted it because it was a parity request that I was not able to make relevant to a larger theme.

The second idea was to make mushroom stem blocks act as wooden logs, so that builders could use the mushroom pore texture; however, I later found out that the mushroom pore texture was easily available in Update Aquatic through different mechanics, so my idea was therefore obsolete.
I could see this being added in game.
Yes I think their should be coloured bricks it will be great to make a house of coloured bricks
This would be great. I mean c'mon guys, you put a glow squid in the game, this is needed! Or paint like on the server games
Yess!! We for sure need colored bricks for house builds !
This has to be included when they make renewable clay in 1.19.
This could also allow for different colored flower pots!

yes i think this is a good way to make building more fun

An idea that I hope gets added one day! I would really like some blue or black bricks for some builds I have
Yes, I want colored bricks! I made a mod once throught MCreator adding colored bricks, but then it got lost. SO PLEASE ADD IT TO MC!

Mojang, you should really add a New Mob to the game, one that maybe works like the breeze but as a different element, and please add a new dimension if that's even possible, I'm not begging I just want to see a new mob related to the blaze & breeze, something earth-like, instead of wind, fire, also, was there a purpose for the crying obsidian?

I dont think there needs to be another way to get iron and gold. Iron is a pretty common ore anyway, and with 1.16, gold will become abundant in the nether, so adding this wouldn't really do much for the game in my opinion

i like the idea, but in many existing minecraft mods there already called wither bones, so maybe that instead. Also maybe giving them more usage than just bonemeal

Along with that they could also add ‘Wither Bone Blocks’ or ‘Charred Bone Blocks’ for another new block. I think they could also replace the coal wither skeletons drop to ‘Wither Essence.’ I think that this should be a new item that is used in brewing stands for brewing Potions of Withering.

Instead of it turning things into dead bushes or making the tall grass die. I think that if you used it on any crops. Wheat, beetroot, carrots, saplings, etc. That it would de-age it. So after it de-ages the crop and it is at its final form, it gives you ashes. Not sure what ashes would do but I would like this feature better than stuff just disappearing.

There should be three types of chocolate
Milk: two cocoa beans, sugar, and milk
Dark: two cocoa beans and two sugar
White: two cocoa butter and two sugar (cocoa butter would be made from smelting cocoa beans)
All recipes produce four bars of chocolate

Poplar sometimes has a greenish gray appearance also.

I was going to suggest the cypress trees. They would add a beautiful new addition to the swamps. We also need some nice big trees, and I thin poplar would be perfect but honestly who doesn't love a gigantic chestnut tree? They can grow in small clearings in roofed forests and could maybe have some branches to climb on. Of course I still love the gray wood as well so why not add both?

also maybe it would be cool to get some more different bark textures?
I wonder if the new mangrove trees will have a gray texture. I hope they do!
I think this could also work by changing swamp trees to have gray wood, or adding petrified wood. I like the idea of having wooden blocks that can fit with stone builds.
Yeah this is pretty important, and natural bamboo needs this too. It gets more and more laggy the taller they grow, and I'm not gonna spend 3 hours cutting them short again x)

would be cool if we could bone meal it, too.
sort of like glow lichen, but.. being able to hang

I think that this would be great, mirroring more of the behavior that glow berry cave vines follow, which sounds like what the kelp follows.

This further entails:
+ being able to stop their growth by using shears on the end pieces instead of needing to use string below them-- a pre-caves and cliffs technique.
+ being able to manually place vines to the bottom to override and have full control over how long you want them to be, just like cave vines, when building.

Agreed! Vines are a fairly old vegetation, which never got updated with the modern mechanics behind recent plants such as Kelp, Bamboo, Cave Vines etc.

Bringing them to "modern" parity would allow both decorative use and world generation to look even better!
I think it should only activate if you hover the cursor over the target for long enough (like tracking rockets in modern FPSs work)
i thought it was homing and you manually make the curve or it is homing
Bows are too OP already. One of the few things that don't make them too rediculous for survival is the chance of missing.
I highly support this idea. Maybe the arrows could have more power as well, so that they deal more damage.

I've seen this suggestion before, and I think it should require you to hit it first, so you have to be able to hit it normally, have an unobstructed view of the target, so you can't just hide and continue to shoot, and for it to lock on them until they die, that way there is some risk in an enchantment that literally locks on enemies. If the target doesn't die in a minute, then it resets.

I think it would look like this:

 

It would be a cool unique shade of green to mess around with!

This would be great but have olives grow in the taiga biome or in the mangroves, perhaps even with its own type of tree. Olives can be used together with a bottle or a bucket to craft olive oil or eaten by themselves. Olive oil can be used as fuel for a furnace and also another added item, oil lanterns. Another source of oil should be an oil sand block found in the dessert. Oil sand block can be heated in a furnace to get crude oil or sludge. Sludge can be useless until crafted into a bottle of oil the same way olive oil is. Oil and gunpowder should also be able to create an ignitable fuse. Something like red stone when laid out on a block. Oil sands should also burn when lit by lava, lightning, flint and steel, etc. when the oil sand block has finished burning, it should turn to regular sand.

Oil pockets could possibly be found in sandstone pockets in nearly every biome but only one to two pockets per biome. Dessert biomes may have more.

Oil could be heated in a furnace or blast furnace to create tar. Tar can be used like slime on a piston to create a stick piston or made into a block. Tar block can have the same characteristics of deep snow when stood on and burned. When a tar block is burned it can ignite other adjacent tar blocks very quickly. Tar can continue to burn for a whole in game day.
Moved to Blocks, Tools, and Items

It can be done now. Either place them on barrier blocks or setblock or fill command them and there you go, floating ladders.
/setblock can still work but if the block gets updated the ladder will be destroyed. This should definitely be implemented.

I'm a year late, but maybe necro-ing this post will make more people notice it - Rope Ladders should totally exist in the game as the means to build more fun stuff, as the means to go caving (Cave Update feature, pog) or simply to go down from a high place, because rather than working like your typical ladders or scaffolding, they would be stacked down to descend a ravine or a treehouse.
For the giant caves in the 1.17 update these ladders would be very usefull, so to avoid ugly pillars of blocks or scaffolding to go down a cave or escape one

But prismarine is a stone-type block...people basically never use stone to make doors....

We already have 7 different types of doors. That's plenty for the vast majority of builds imho.

Saying people don't use stone doors is like saying people don't care about the UFO's that have been in minecraft for the last five years.

Much like the UFO's there are no stone doors in minecraft for people to be using in the first place.

A stone variant to doors would honestly be a nice addition. The more options we have for getting creative the better, and prismarine doors sound perfect.

I think MacchuPicchu is saying that people, IRL, don't use stone to make doors.  And that's true.  Stone tends to be too heavy and difficult to work with to make good doors.

However, this is Minecraft.  More door textures would mostly just give more creative options.  If it helps, you could think of these doors as styled to look like/match prismarine rather than being made of prismarine.
Just use a piston door with prismarine.  There is no need for a whole new door.
I also like the idea of doors made from materials other than wood and iron...gold, all the stone types etc. Would be great for castle secret entrances etc.

Bilbo Baggins 

Based on that logic I could just as easily say: "That's silly. Just use a piston and wood blocks. there's no real need for wooden doors."

ClayGoddessSari

Commonly, no we don't usually make doors out of stone. However there's a difference between "Not the norm", and "Does not happen"

Here's a couple examples:

https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e4/Stone_door_-_Desert_castle_-_Jordan.jpeg

https://stonetownheritagesociety.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/11-1-small-door-msikiti-barza.jpg

what it needs is flamethrowers, rocket launchers, and other guns like those! also mechs and starfighters that players can customize to look like whatever we want

Yes! I would love to see an item where you could actually see the mobs due to their vibrations from a Warden drop!

Maybe we can equip the sculk antennas but we'll have to loose our eyes(permanently or temporarily). This will give us new gameplay features like -
1) We won't see the world but instead we'll see the different noises and vibrations in different forms and colours on a completely dark background.
2) The more noise or vibrations that object makes the more clearer its form is.
3) The range of detection can vary with the altitude like we can have high range in the deep caves and low range in mountains or maybe reverse.
It would also look cool as hell when wearing it

Yes, This would be a great addition to the caves and cliffs update! I can just imagine it now, everything is black except blocks near you and things that are making vibrations like mobs and players that aren't sneaking! Maybe even seeing through walls as long as it's not made of wool! It would be awesome looking too!
Oh, and what If it helps you see in the end as well? It would add to a reason to actually try to attack the warden, cuz it helps you beat Minecraft!

That'd be sick as hell. Imagine you put it on, and the screen goes black, but when something make's noise, it's shape and form become a static blue shape, with the brightness and density of the color depending on the loudness and distance from the noise.
Mojang said they they don't want players to attack the Warden but instead run from it like a natural disaster. They are not adding anything of worth.

Maybe it can be a big black background, but anything that makes(or is making) vibrations will turn cyan. This will also affect pistons and the block that they are moving.

You would also see blocks that are being mined.

All of this would work unless there is wool
